#Text=More suspected plane debris washes ashore on Maldives island
#Text=Thursday , August 13 , 2015
#Text=Debris believed to be part of an aircraft has washed ashore on an uninhabited island in the Maldives .
#Text=The fragment , suspected to be from a wing , was found on Mendhoo island , within the Laamu Atoll .

#Text=The finding comes after several pieces of suspected plane debris washed ashore on the resort island Vabbinfaru , within the Kaafu Atoll , some of which could be from Malaysia Airlines Flight 370 ( MH370 ) .
#Text=The newest piece of debris is white and severely damaged and dented in places .
#Text=Some of the paint also appears to be peeling off .
#Text=Authorities have collected the debris , to be examined later .
#Text=Malaysian

#Text=officials are currently investigating other debris to determine if they came from an aircraft and if so " discussions will be held to determine the next steps in terms of the process of analysis " , said the Malaysian transport ministry in a statement .
#Text=File photo of suspected plane debris that washed ashore the Maldive Kaafu Atoll on May 31 .
#Text=Image : Mohamed Wafir ( via Facebook ) .

#Text=On Tuesday , a team of Malaysian investigators arrived in Maldives to take charge of debris washed ashore on Vabbinfaru on May 31 , which had previously been disposed of as trash , and transport it back to Malaysia for further analysis .
#Text=Malaysia said they believe the debris could be from MH370 , but no official confirmation has been made .

#Text=" We ( Malaysia ) have an understanding with the authorities there [ the Maldives ] [ ... ] we think the parts which were found about a month ago were parts of the aircraft , " said Ab Aziz Kaprawi , the deputy transport minister for Malaysia as quoted by Bernama , a Malaysian government news agency .
#Text=" They have to be further analysed and will be brought back to Malaysia for verification " , he added .

#Text=Since the Vabbinfaru incident , debris has washed ashore on at least three other Maldives locations , the Baa Atoll and the islands of Fehendhoo and Fulhahdhoo , but much of it is n't believed to be from an aircraft .
#Text=Abdulla Rasheed , a captain of a cargo boat which recently capsized in the waters off the Maldives , stated , "

#Text= We are collecting any unidentified debris and storing them in a warehouse so that the Malaysians can carry out tests and determine if it is from their plane or not , " said the office of the Maldives President in a statement reported by Haveeru Daily before the Malaysian investigators arrived .

column1: #Text=MH370 , while flying from Kuala Lumpur , Malaysia to Beijing , China , vanished on March 8 , 2014 .
#Text=All 239 passengers and crew are believed to be dead .
#Text=On the day the plane went missing , residents on the small Maldives island of Kudahuvadhoo claimed to have seen a very " low flying jumbo jet " crash into the Indian Ocean .
#Text=Some also noted the colors appeared to resemble that of a Malaysia Airlines plane .
#Text=" I 've never seen a jet flying so low over our island before .

#Text= Based on the monitoring up to date , no indication of Flight MH370 has been observed on any military radars in the country [ Maldives ] .
